item.title: Best Pokemon Mobile Games & Apps, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon Jukebox offered limited free songs but struggled against the competition.
  • Camp Pokemon was aimed at teaching children about Pokemon and was discontinued after three years.
  • Pokemon TCG Live is a digital version of the trading card game with deck-building features.

The Pokemon franchise has captivated the minds and hearts of several generations. The international franchise can be seen on hundreds of mobile phones worldwide. Plenty of fans have installed several apps that feature Pokemon to entertain them during their day. These mobile games and apps have been downloaded millions of times since the release of the original TV series.

The Pokemon series fans are currently participating in the 2024 Pokemon events in Japan. Pokemon GO , Pokemon UNITE , and Pokemon TCG are a few of the biggest mobile gaming titles involved in these events. Take a look at the best Pokemon mobile games and apps available for smartphones.

Updated March 21, 2025 by Ben Painter: Pokemon fans have long given up on getting the chance to play a proper mainline Pokemon game on mobile as long as Nintendo is in charge. But there are plenty of other options for fans of the franchise looking for mobile apps and games about Pokemon.

With the massive success of Pokemon GO and, to a lesser extent Pokemon UNITE, the developers felt ready to put more of their eggs in this basket in the form of a mobile rendition of the popular Pokemon Trading Card Game. This update adds four more of the best Pokemon mobile apps and games.

18 Pokemon Jukebox

A Pokemon Music Streaming Service

  • Release Date : June 23, 2015
  • Developer : The Pokemon Company
  • Platforms : Android

Pokemon Jukebox was a music streaming service that allowed fans to listen to soundtracks from Pokemon games, which was a great idea in theory. However, users were limited to just three free songs per day, while they could purchase music to listen to without restrictions.

The app lasted only a year, largely due to the popularity of services like Spotify and YouTube, where these songs could be accessed without any limitations. In today's world, an app like Pokemon Jukebox would struggle to succeed given the convenience of music available on smartphones.

17 Camp Pokemon

An Interactive Game To Teach Children Pokemon

  • Release Date : October 21, 2014 (iOS), April 14, 2016 (Android)
  • Developer : Creatures, Inc.
  • Platforms : iOS and Android

Camp Pokemon was designed for young children to teach them the basics of Pokemon, making it easier for them to play the mainline games in the future. The camp featured activities like "Pokemon in Focus," which helped kids learn about the different creatures, and "Battle Matchups," which educated them on the intricacies of battling.

The game was active for about three years and received a significant update for Generation 7 in 2017. However, this marked the end of the game, and it was ultimately discontinued. Fans who still have the game on their devices can play it, but it is no longer available for download.

16 Pokemon TCG Live

A Digital Version Of The Trading Card Game

Pokemon TCG Live offers players a chance to practice the physical Pokemon Trading Card Game in a digital format, both as a means for understanding the rules of the game and for getting familiar with the proper strategies and synergies a properly built deck of Pokemon Cards is supposed to have.

New Pokemon cards can be obtained by unwrapping packs that can be obtained using the in-game currency. Battles can be fought casually to test out decks or in a ranked format where equally skilled players are pitted against one another through a proper matchmaking system.

15 Pokemon Playhouse

Aimed At The Younger Generation

  • Release Date : September 21, 2017
  • Developer : The Pokemon Company
  • Platforms : Android and iOS

Pokemon Playhouse is a game meant to introduce children to the world of Pokemon in the form of educational content that helps develop their motor skills. The game features multiple small mini-games players can partake in, with no real way of "losing." Players can groom Pokemon using brushes to straighten their hair, a sponge to clean dirt off or apply a bandage if they're hurt, and more. The visuals help identify what the problem with each Pokemon is, allowing kids to learn by doing.

Feeding is a visual learning mini-game that works by showing the players which berry a Pokemon prefers before the timer starts and then giving each Pokemon the type of berry they like from a plate on a conveyor belt as it moves across the screen. There is also a connect-the-dots mini-game that reveals the figure of a Pokemon, reminiscent of the 'Who's that Pokemon?' segment from the original TV show. As a reward for completing these mini-games, a new egg hatches, introducing a new Pokemon to the Playhouse.

14 DataDex

A Portable Pokedex

  • Release Date : October 14, 2016
  • Developer : TalZz
  • Platforms : Android

DataDex is a portable Pokedex that can be used by people of all ages. The digital Pokedex has updated information on Pokemon, including the Scarlet & Violet generation. It has multi-language support, providing details on Pokemon for native speakers in English, Italian, German, Spanish, French, Portuguese, and Hebrew.

Pokemon Trainers can search through the dataDex to find dozens of Pokemon. It has a range of filters to narrow down searches to access information on different kinds of Pokemon in an instant. DataDex has a Team Builder to help people create their Pokemon dream team . Pokemon from 7 generations are listed on the dataDex , enabling people to find any Pokemon on one app. It also displays the best type of Pokemon that Trainers can play to win against stronger opponents.

13 Pokemon Smile

Aimed To Help Children Brush Their Teeth

Pokemon Smile is a kid-friendly app that helps children brush their teeth. It uses the smartphone’s camera to scan for plaque in the mouth while brushing. Kids can rescue various types of Pokemon found inside their mouth after brushing their teeth in the morning with Pokemon Smile .

The children’s education app is available on Android and iOS. It encourages kids to brush their teeth daily to brighten their smiles . Pokemon Smile rewards children with decorative Pokemon Caps that can be placed on their heads to take fun photos with the family. Unlike Pokemon GO , people can only play Pokemon Smile in their bathrooms, limiting its usability. Children need an adult around them to brush their teeth safely on the app to avoid mishaps. Pokemon walking around the jawline can easily flee, drastically decreasing the amount of Pokemon that Trainers can catch on Pokemon Smile .

12 Pokemon Sleep

A Sleep Tracking App With The Fun Of Pokemon

Pokemon Sleep is a sleep-tracking app incentivizing users to sleep longer and better unlock new 'Sleep styles,' a mechanic unique to this app. Each time a user sleeps, the app tries to match the nature of the sleep with the 'Sleep Style' of a Pokemon. For example, if a night was particularly restful, users may be greeted with a 'Squirtle Sheltered Sleep' which is a Slumbering Sleep style, but if there were lots of tossing and turning, they'd likely get a 'Primeape Angry Sleep,' which is a Dozing Sleep style.

Players start with a small group of Pokemon in the app, and new Pokemon are unlocked as users use the app and achieve certain milestones. Achieving a high sleep score increases the chance of receiving a shiny or rare Pokemon. The sleep score is determined by the quality of the sleep cycle and how much Snorlax, the mascot of the app, is fed during the day.

11 Pokemon Rumble Rush

A Swiping Battle Adventure

  • Release Date : May 22, 2019 (Android), July 23, 2019 (iOS)
  • Developer : Ambrella
  • Platforms : iOS & Android

The Pokemon Rumble series began in 2009 on the Wii as a WiiWare game. Several sequels followed, including the latest entry, Pokemon Rumble Rush , which introduced the concept to mobile devices for the first time. Gameplay-wise, it differed significantly from the mainline series. Players could battle and capture wild Pokemon, but this was done by swiping at the screen in real-time battles.

The design of the Pokemon featured a charming blend of chibi and origami styles, providing a refreshing change of pace. However, this game only lasted a year before the servers were shut down, making it no longer playable.

10 Pokemon TV

A Way To Watch The Pokemon Anime

  • Release Date : February 12, 2013 (iOS and Android)
  • Developer : The Pokemon Company
  • Platforms : iOS & Android

In the early 2000s, watching the Pokemon anime was often challenging, as fans had to wait for episodes to air on TV without access to physical media. This changed in 2010 with the launch of the Pokemon TV website, followed by a mobile app in 2013. Fans could watch episodes and movies of the anime whenever they wanted, allowing them to enjoy the content at their leisure.

Unlike many other apps, Pokemon TV enjoyed a long run before shutting down in 2024. However, fans didn’t lose everything, as Pokemon TV transitioned to YouTube. Currently, only the first Kanto adventures are available there, with full episodes being updated regularly.

9 Pokemon HOME

Used To Trade Pokemon Between Games

  • Release Date : February 12, 2020
  • Developer : Game Freak
  • Platforms : Nintendo Switch, iOS, and Android

Pokemon HOME is a mobile app that makes it easy to store and trade Pokemon from various games. Pokemon Trainers can view their entire collection of Pokemon that they’ve caught and trained over the years in Pokemon HOME . It included a number of game titles, including Pokemon Scarlet, Pokemon Violet, Pokemon Legends: Arceus, Pokemon Brilliant Diamond, Pokemon Sword, Pokemon Shield, and Pokemon: Let’s Go, Pikachu!

Players can trade their Pokemon at any time using Pokemon HOME . Setting different parameters to trade Pokemon can be simple and fast with the app. Research Tasks can be completed on Pokemon HOME based on specific regions like Kanto and Johto. The Premium plan for Pokemon Home allows people to store up to 6,000 Pokemon.

8 Pokemon Cafe ReMix

A Cooking Game With A Poke-Twist

Pokemon Cafe ReMix lets players craft their own drinks and dishes to please their guests. Befriseveralr of Pokemon and use their special abilities to solve puzzles at the Pokemon Cafe. Players can increase the items available at the Pokemon Cafe by completing the puzzles to acquire new ingredients for their recipes.

Eevee is among the first Pokemon people can train in Pokemon Cafe ReMix . It has tons of gameplay to help players upgrade their recipes for their customers. Unlock events and outfits to entice customers into the Pokemon Cafe ReMix with delicious dishes. Evolved Pokemon are fun to watch on the app as they serve food instead of dashing at other Pokemon to win battles.

7 Pokemon Quest

A Blocky RPG

Pokemon Quest is an action RPG that takes place on Tumblecube Island. The game design makes it unique to the eyes of gamers, with cube-like Pokemon popping up around the map. People will find that these charming Pokemon are irresistible.

Expeditions within Pokemon Quest provide a variety of items. These items can be used to cook scrumptious food at the base. Food items prepared in the app can be consumed with Pokemon in a team and attract wild Pokemon in the game. However, Pokemon can use up to 2 moves during battles, decreasing the attacks available to defeat enemies.

6 Pokemon Shuffle Mobile

Puzzle Games Meet Pokemon

Pokemon Shuffle Mobile combines the most exciting features of Pokemon with puzzle games. Mobile gamers can line up Pokemon and destroy them with their moves to clear the stage. There are over 150 Pokemon that can be found in the wild. Fight and catch all 150 Pokemon by dealing an enormous amount of damage.

The mobile app adds several stages regularly into the game. People can easily encounter Pokemon like Charmander, Squirtle, and Bulbasaur in Pokemon Shuffle Mobile to win battles. Watching the cute heads of Pokemon explode on screen can be immensely satisfying compared to other Pokemon games on smartphones. Unique combos can be created using different Pokemon to beat rare Pokemon in special stages, making Pokemon Shuffle Mobile a highly-rated app among fans of the franchise.

5 Pokemon: Magikarp Jump

Magikarp's Staring Role

Pokemon: Magikarp Jump is a dedicated game featuring Magikarp, the most docile Pokemon in the wild. Many people like Magikarp for its humble nature and its simple attack patterns, as well as its ability to evolve into the powerful Gyarados.

Food is easily found in the mobile game, allowing people to sustain the growth of their Magikarps. There are several colorful Magikarps found in Pokemon: Magikarp Jump , making the game exciting. Rare Magikarps can be caught within hours of starting a new game. The leagues available in Pokemon: Magikarp Jump are worth trying for their sheer sense of astonishment. Custom items and decorations in the mobile app can amaze seasoned Pokemon Trainers.

4 Pokemon Masters EX

Three-on-three Realtime Pokemon Battles

  • Release Date : August 28, 2019
  • Developer : Dena Co.
  • Platforms : Android and iOS

Battle Pokemon trainers from various Pokemon titles in Pokemon Masters EX . Players can challenge a gamut of memorable characters from the franchise to level up their Pokemon in the game. These Pokemon trainers and their partners in Pokemon Masters EX are tough to defeat while roaming the island of Pasio.

The Pokemon Masters League tournament is being held on Pasio, giving players a chance to claim glory for themselves. Enjoy 3v3 battles in Pokemon Masters Ex to fight with legends like Red, Blue, Misty, and Brock . Regular rewards and training events have been key aspects of Pokemon Masters Ex over the past few years.

3 Pokemon UNITE

Multiplayer Pokemon Battle Arena

Pokemon UNITE is a spectacular mobile game that lets players fight 5v5 battles. Enthusiastic trainers can level up their Pokemon and evolve them to crush their enemies before the time runs out in Pokemon UNITE . Each Pokemon in battles can knock out their opponents to collect Aeos, the energy in the game, to score more points for their team.

There are plenty of items in Pokemon UNITE that can turn fights into fantastic battles. Pokemon trainers can use battle items, held items, and boost emblems to increase the effectiveness of the attacks of their Pokemon. Held items in the mobile game can help Pokemon recover health during fights to sustain loads of damage from their foes. Fighting Zapdos in the final moments of a match can provide a burst of Aeos to motivate the team.

2 Pokemon GO

Turning Real Locations Into Pokemon Adventures

Pokemon GO has been downloaded more than 100 million times on mobile devices. Join friends online on smartphones to discover Pokemon across major locations in every city. Activities like walking around the city in Pokemon GO can be used to hatch eggs in the game.

Take part in action-packed Gym battles and Battle Leagues to earn robust rewards in Pokemon GO . A combination of fast attacks and charged attacks with the Pokemon can derail opponents within seconds of starting a match. Dealing critical damage in battles with a variety of Pokemon in the game can be thrilling on mobile devices, making Pokemon GO the best app on mobile for Pokemon fanatics.

1 Pokemon TCG Pocket

The Pokemon Trading Card Game Done Right

Pokemon TCG Pocket is a reimagining of the Pokemon Trading Card Game on mobile platforms, meant to introduce new players who aren’t familiar with the Pokemon TCG scene to enter on equal footing with the veterans. While the broad strokes of the game remain the same; it’s turn-based and uses Pokemon Cards for battle purposes, the details have been simplified to make learning easier for new players.

The main difference between Pokemon TCG Pocket and Pokemon TCG Live is the fact that they use different rules for the actual battles. Deck size is reduced from 60 to 20 to facilitate faster games and Energy Card requirements for using moves are streamlined. Pocket also offers players two free booster packs every day, which allows even F2P players a chance to build decent decks without spending money on microtransactions.

item.title: Red Dead Redemption 2: Best Weapons For Bison, Ranked
item.description:
The Bison is a beautiful animal found in Red Dead Redemption 2 , and despite its majestic nature roaming the wild plains, it’s often a good animal worth hunting for the meat that it provides the Van der Linde camp and the valuables that can be obtained from its fur and its horns. However, players are going to need the perfect weapons to hunt a Bison to take it down in one clean shot.

It’s not fair on a poor creature to terrorize it with a weapon, so the most humane thing a hunter in Red Dead Redemption 2 can do is execute with one shot, providing a clean kill so that the animal doesn’t feel pain and goes down before it fears for its life. As such, we’ve found the best weapons for the perfect pelts and cleanest kills for Bison.

Bison can be found most commonly in the Great Plains of West Elizabeth near Black Water and The Heartlands in New Hanover.

6 Bow with a Poison Arrow

The Poison Arrow Pierces Thick Hides and Puts Animals to Sleep

  • How to Get: Purchase the Poison Arrow Pamphlet from a Fence and craft with x1 Arrow, x1 Oleander Sage, x1 Flight Feather

The Poison Arrow from the Bow doesn’t seem like the most deadly of weapons, especially when it’s the Old West where iron and lead rain supreme against combatants. However, there’s something more natural about using a Bow, especially with a Poison Arrow that requires herbs to get working so that one can feel closer to nature in the big hunt.

The Bow is a great hunting weapon on its own, but with the crafted Poison Arrows, players can hit the Bison that they seek, and the poison will slowly take effect and cause the Bison to topple over and fall into a slumber before succumbing to the effects of the poison.

5 Poison Throwing Knife

A Fast-Throwing Knife to Poison Animals

  • How to Get: Find the Poison Throwing Knife Pamphlet in a wooden shack in the North East area of Saint Denis, underneath a floorboard, then craft it with x1 Throwing Knife, x2 Oleander Sage

The Poison Throwing Knife is also a good weapon to use against the Bison, for it throws quickly and can be done so during stealth. Players can also get their hands on plenty of throwing knives thanks to the fence, and crafting them only requires a single herb so it’s not going to be hard to obtain a bundle of them.

Just by throwing this poisoned-tip knife, players will be able to take out a bison, and even recover the blade once the bison falls. It’s a clean and quiet way of doing things, but the throwing range of the knife requires players to be a bit too close for comfort.

4 Springfield Rifle

A Single-Shot Rifle with Great Power

  • How to Get: Purchased from any Gunsmith after Chapter 1 for $120.

The Springfield Rifle is the first rifle that players can own after leaving Colter for Horseshoe Overlook in New Hanover. Since Chapter 2 is really the start of the game since the whole map opens up for players to explore, the Springfield Rifle will be the first rifle that players acquire, and that makes it pretty good to use for those, not in the later chapters.

While the Springfield Rifle is not the best, it does get the job done reliably thanks to its single bullet in the chamber. However, the slow firing of said rifle means that players won’t be able to take out multiple bison, but instead, just the one they need.

3 Bolt-Action Rifle

A 5-Shot Rifle with Strengthened Bullets and Faster Fire

  • How to Get: Acquired during the Preaching Forgiveness as He Wants mission in Chapter 3, or purchased from any Gunsmith for $180 after said mission.

The Bolt-Action Rifle is the best rifle in Red Dead Redemption 2 that doesn’t have a scope already equipped for it. Since the Bolt-Action Rifle already comes with an ammo capacity of 5 bullets, it can already be seen as superior to the Springfield Rifle, as players have a more generous window to miss shots or take out multiple bison at once.

The Bolt-Action Rifle has incredible stopping power, especially when aiming at the head of a bison. However, the same rules still apply, since this weapon is a loud one indeed, and bison will attempt to run away from the moment this gun is fired – luckily multiple shots mean more bison to take down.

2 Carcano Rifle

The Best Sniper Rifle in Terms of Fire Rate and Ammo Capacity

  • How to Get: Automatically acquired in The Delights of Van Horn / Goodbye, Dear Friend missions in Chapter 6, or purchased for $190 at any Gunsmith after either mission.

The Carcano Rifle is the best sniper in Red Dead Redemption 2 , and it can also be argued that it’s the best rifle altogether since it boasts the most ammo, the best rate of fire, and has a long scope built into the weapon itself.

The Carcano Rifle means that players can snipe at the bison from a distance, watching them through the scope until they deem the time is right to take them out. While players can’t go wrong with this weapon, it’s worth noting it’s endgame loot, since it can be acquired halfway into Chapter 6, whereas alternative weapons are unlocked far earlier.

1 Rolling Block Rifle

A Scoped Rifle with the Best Damage

  • How to Get: Purchased for $0 at the Valentine Gunsmith during the Chapter 2 mission: The Sheep and the Goats. Alternatively acquired from any gunsmith for $187 after said mission.

The Rolling Block Rifle has damage that rivals a shotgun up close but also has the range to warrant shooting from as far away as possible. If a target can be viewed in the scope, then it’s going down in one hit, which is why the Rolling Block Rifle is so reliable against the largest of animals and beasts that players will come across.

Whether it’s legendary animals or the bison, the Rolling Block Rifle will get the job done in one easy shot, especially when using High Velocity or Express rounds to truly take the wind out of any creature with the maximum damage possible, showing that even with an ammo capacity of 1 bullet, it’s all that’s needed.

item.title: Atelier Yumia: How to Fast Travel
item.description:
Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land gives players a vast world to explore. There are various regions, and within each region there are dozens of areas and landmarks to find.

Given the size of the map in Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land , players will want to make sure that they get access to as many fast travel locations as possible right away. This articles shows players how to unlock fast travel in Atelier Yumia and how to find every fast travel point on the map.

How to Unlock Fast Travel in Atelier Yumia

To create fast travel points in Atelier Yumia , gamers must find and interact with Old Guide Towers , which are small pink-hued towers with a large crystal on top. Once near an Old Guide Tower, players will be able to unlock it, which will change its color to blue and give them access to a new fast travel point.

From then on, the location will appear blue on their map and have a red checkmark next to it. Players can travel to that location by opening their world map and interacting with it.

How to Find Old Guide Towers in Atelier Yumia

Thankfully, fans won't have to aimlessly wander around the map in order to locate Old Guide Towers in Atelier Yumia . Old Guide Towers are displayed on the player's map with an icon .

If gamers open their map, they'll notice several square icons with a circle in the middle - these indicate Old Guide Towers. Players must head towards these areas and unlock the Old Guide Towers to get access to them as fast travel points.

item.title: Weird Stardew Valley Bug Makes Pam Lurk on Player's Farm
item.description:
Summary

  • Pam appearing on player's farm at 1:30 am is a strange bug in Stardew Valley.
  • Numerous bugs reported following recent patches, like NPCs destroying objects.
  • While frustrating, some players find NPCs visiting farms immersive.

A Stardew Valley player was spooked when they discovered that Pam was hanging around on their farm. The strange Stardew Valley bug not only made Pam appear somewhere she ordinarily never goes, but it also happened at a weird time.

Stardew Valley has seen numerous bug reports recently following patches releasing for the game. Unfortunately, some of the fixes seem to have introduced their own problems. This particular bug is one that's cropped up recently, though it's not entirely clear what's behind it.

Stardew Valley player and Reddit user strangerabbitart shared a screenshot of their bizarre discovery of finding Pam standing on their farmland. Under normal circumstances, Pam never goes to the player's property, only sending letters through the mail. One can likely imagine being startled and confused to find the NPC suddenly standing there, but it's made even weirder by the fact that it's 1:30 am. Given the game's schedule, Pam should have gone home and to bed by that point, with the Stardrop Saloon, her usual evening hangout, having closed for the night. The surreal moment is only heightened by having Pam casually asking about what kind of food the farmer has growing.

Stardew Valley Player Share Stories of Rogue NPC Appearances

In the comments, players have been discussing this odd moment and sharing some of their own. It would seem that NPCs appearing on farms has been happening to more than one player, though not everyone is upset by it. Some players like the immersion of having NPCs randomly visiting them on their farm. However, not everyone is so fond of the bug. Other players have shared stories of Stardew Valley villagers - and Pam, in particular - appearing on players' farms and proceeding to walk across them, destroying any solid objects in their path. It's easy to see how that would quickly become frustrating, especially if there was no way of predicting when an NPC would show up.

While this bug seems to be fairly new, Stardew Valley NPCs having weird pathfinding isn't entirely uncommon. Players have been sharing stories for years of their NPC spouses randomly walking outside their homes through solid walls, or discovering NPCs standing around in random places in the middle of the night. Players may want to take care to leave an open path on their farm in case an NPC appears, or at least ensure that nothing valuable is around the entrance where it could potentially get destroyed. With any luck, a patch will fix this in the near future, but having NPCs coming to visit could be a fun feature to add somewhere down the line.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Fan Creates Mysterio Strategist Concept
item.description:
Summary

  • Marvel Rivals has potential for new characters, with fans suggesting villains like Mysterio.
  • A fan-designed concept features Mysterio as a playable Strategist with unique abilities.
  • Players have reacted positively to the idea of adding Mysterio to Marvel Rivals.

A Marvel Rivals fan has designed a concept kit that imagines Mysterio as a playable Strategist. Marvel Rivals has 37 characters ranging from well-known heroes to feared villains from the comics. But while the game's cast has proved very popular, there is still a lot of potential for NetEase to explore.

Regarding the villains that Marvel Rivals could add, there's no shortage of suggestions, such as Doctor Octopus, Sandman, and the Green Goblin. The developers have already shown that they are attentive to player feedback, having asked Marvel Rivals players which characters they want to see next. While many of these choices don't come true, one creative fan has shared their idea for a famous name.

Redditor GhostsinGlass created a kit concept for Mysterio, Spider-Man's famous antagonist. Imagined as a Marvel Rivals Strategist, his normal attack would be "Lightshow," an explosion of photonic energy. His passive would be "Timely Demise." With it, when Mysterio is close to death, a robotic clone would appear to fight as if it were him, subsequently dying in a huge explosion. The OP didn't reveal who his team-up, "Star Power," would be with, though they defined it as "something to enhance the healing of other Strategists," allowing Mysterio to do other things.

Marvel Rivals Fan Creates Mysterio Concept Designed to 'Make Spider-Man's Life Worse'

According to the kit put together by the OP, another Mysterio ability would be "Roaring Fantarre," letting him shoot balls of healing fireworks. With "Round of Applause," he would restore his teammates' health and shields while tricking enemies into believing they are full HP. Using "Mag-Coil Boots," he would leap into the air in a flash of blinding light, being able to attach himself to a wall temporarily. Finally, the iconic villain's ultimate would be "Lights, Camera, Action." With it, Mysterio would use his mastery of illusions to make enemies in sight experience hallucinations of being attacked. In addition to receiving damage, if enemies killed one of the hallucinations, they would be teleported to a random location.

Players reacted positively to GhostsinGlass' idea, with many saying that Mysterio is one of the characters they want most to see in the game. Others gave suggestions, such as Mysterio being a diving Duelist or his ult turning all players into him. There's still no official word on whether Mysterio will be added to the game, although players believe it's a matter of time given, his importance in the comics. With Marvel Rivals having more seasons already planned, the community waits to see if Mysterio will eventually debut in one of them.
